relation: Details
What kind of materials are in the collection?
Is special software needed to listen to the audiobooks to my computer?
Are apps available for my tablet or smartphone?
What devices are compatible with the collections?
Will I need my library card?*
How many titles can be checked out at a time?
How long is the loan period?
Can I place holds on titles?
Can titles be renewed?
Can I accumulate overdue fines?
Can I burn the audiobooks to CD?
What if I have technical questions or problems?
Overdrive
Unabridged and abridged MP3 and WMA audiobooks
Yes, the Overdrive desktop app
Yes, the Overdrive app for iOS, Android, Kindle Fire/HD, Nook Color/Tablet, and Windows 8 devices
The list of supported devices is available here.
Yes and your PIN. Your card must be in good standing.
7, 14, or 21 days
Yes, if a title is checked out, you must put your name on a waiting list for it
Titles can renewed once during the original checkout period if no one else is on the waiting list
Titles are returned automatically so no overdues
Yes, many can be burned to CD

See the Help section of the Overdrive website and our New User Guides for audiobooks and the Overdrive app. You can also contact the Library's Virtual Information Center by phone (513-369-6900) or Email.
OneClick Digital
Unabridged MP3 and DRM-free WMA audiobooks
Yes, OneClick Digital Media Manager
Yes, the OneClick Digital app for iOS, Android, and Kindle Fire devices
The list of supported devices is available here
Yes and your PIN. You will also need to create a free account with OneClick.
Any loan period up to 21 days
Yes, but most audiobooks are always available so you don't have to put holds on them
Titles can be renewed once during the original checkout period
Titles are returned automatically so no overdues
No
See the Help section of the OneClick website. You can also contact the Library's Virtual Information Center by phone (513-369-6900) or Email
Hoopla
Streaming unabridged and abridged audiobooks
Yes, Widevine Media Optimizer, an add-on for your web browser
Yes, the Hoopla Digital app for iOS and Android devices
The list of supported devices is available in the "Technical Questions" section of Hoopla Help
Yes and your PIN. You will also need to create a free account with Hoopla.
21 days
Hoopla Digital titles are always available so you don't have to put holds on them
Titles cannot be renewed
Titles are returned automatically so no overdues
No
See the Help section of the Hoopla website. You can also contact the Library's Virtual Information Center by phone (513-369-6900) or email.
